intro: Calycolpus, commonly known as the redwood fern, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Araliaceae. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas, particularly Central and South America. The plants are characterized by their compound leaves and produce small, greenish flowers that are often clustered in umbels. Calycolpus species typically grow as shrubs or small trees, reaching heights of up to several meters. They are valued for their ornamental foliage and are sometimes cultivated in shaded garden environments.
